intro: Conyza argentea, commonly known as silverleaf weed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Africa, now found in various regions around the world. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which results from dense pubescence covering the leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields and roadsides. Conyza argentea is considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
